analyzed: dṛṣṭānta mātre eva prasaṅga prasaṅga viparyyayābhyām kṣaṇabhaṅga prasādhanāt nanu ābhyām eva pakṣe kṣaṇabhaṅga siddhiḥ astu iti ced
translated: Because momentariness is established merely in the example by the reductio and the contraposition of the reductio. If it is argued that momentariness should be established in the subject by these two alone,

analyzed: astu kaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: let it be so. What is the fault?

original: yo hi pratipattā prativastu yadyadā yajjananavyavahārayogyaṃ tattadā tajjanayatītyā dikamupanyasituṃ analasastasya tata eva kṣaṇabhaṅgasiddhiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ hi pratipattā prati vastu yat yadā yat janana vyavahāra yogyam tat tadā tat janayati iti ā dikam upanyasitum analasaḥ tasya tatas eva kṣaṇa bhaṅga siddhiḥ
translated: For that respondent who is not lazy to present such things as whenever something is fit to be called the producer of another at that time it produces that, for him the momentariness is established by that alone.

original: yastu prativastu tannyāyopanyāsaprayāsabhīruḥ sa ttvekatradharmmiṇi yadyadā yajjananavyavahārayogyaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ tu prativastu tad nyāya upanyāsa prayāsa bhīruḥ sa tu ekatra dharmmiṇi yat yadā yat janana vyavahāra yogyam
translated: But one who is afraid of the effort of stating the reasoning for each thing, for him, in one subject, whatever is fit to be called productive at one time,

analyzed: tat tadā tat janayati ityādi nyāyena sattva mātram asthairyya vyāptam avadhārya sattvāt eva anyatra
translated: But he who is afraid of the trouble of applying the reasoning to each individual object, he, in one substratum, having ascertained by the principle stated in the words, Whatever is capable of being spoken of as the producer of another at a certain time, produces that at that time, that mere existence is pervaded by impermanence, infers momentariness in other cases also

analyzed: kṣaṇikatvam avagacchati iti  katham apramattaḥ vaiyarthyam asya ācakṣīta tat evam eka artha kāriṇaḥ ghaṭasya dvitīya ādi kṣaṇa bhāvi kāryya apekṣayā
translated: from existence alone.🔽How can one who is not negligent call this inference useless? Thus, of a jar which performs one function, there is difference, because of the contradiction of the nature of being capable and being incapable with regard to the effect which exists in the second moment and subsequent moments.

original: samarthetarasvabhāvavirudvadharmmā dhyāsāt bheda eveti kṣaṇabhaṅgatayā sapakṣatāmāvahati
analyzed: samartha itara svabhāva virudva dharmmā dhyāsāt bhedaḥ eva iti kṣaṇabhaṅga tayā sapakṣa tām āvahati
translated: Thus, it brings about the possibility of being a similar instance by momentariness.

analyzed: ghaṭe sattve hetuḥ upalabhyamānaḥ na virudvaḥ
translated: The reason existence in the jar is not contradictory, being perceived.

analyzed: na ca ayam manaikāntikaḥ
translated: And it is not inconclusive.

original: atraiva sādharmmyavati dṛṣṭānte sarvvopasaṃhāravatyā vyāpteḥ prasādhanāt /
analyzed: atra eva sādharmmyavati dṛṣṭānte sarvva upasaṃhāravatyāḥ vyāpteḥ prasādhanāt
translated: Because the pervasion is established by the inclusion of all in this very example which has the property to be proved.

original: nanu viparyyaye bādhakapramāṇabalābdyāptisiddhistasya copanyāsavārttāpi nāsti tatkathaṃ vyāptiḥ prasādhiteti cet /
analyzed: nanu viparyyaye bādhaka pramāṇa bala āpti āpti siddhiḥ tasya ca upanyāsa vārttā api nā asti tat katham vyāptiḥ prasādhitā iti ced
translated: But if it is argued that the establishment of the pervasion is by the force of the evidence which contradicts the contrary, and that there is not even a mention of its application, how then is the pervasion established?

analyzed: tat etat taralatara buddhi vilasitam
translated: This is the sportive manifestation of a very unsteady mind.

analyzed: tathā hi uktam etat varttamāna kṣaṇa bhāvi kāryya karaṇa kāle atīta anāgata kṣaṇa bhāvi kāryye
translated: For this has been said: At the time when the present moment of the pot is producing its effect, even in the future and past moments,

original: 'pi ghaṭasya śaktisambhave tadānīmevaitat karaṇamakaraṇe ca śaktāśaktasvabhāvatayā
analyzed: pi ghaṭasya śakti sambhave tadānīm eva etat karaṇam akaraṇe ca śakta aśakta svabhāva tayā
translated: the pot has the capacity to produce its effect. At that very time, due to having the nature of being capable or incapable of producing the effect,

original: pratikṣaṇaṃ bheda iti kṣaṇikatvena vyāptaiva sā arthakriyāśaktiḥ /
analyzed: pratikṣaṇam bhedaḥ iti kṣaṇika tvena vyāptā eva sā arthakriyāśaktiḥ
translated: there is difference from moment to moment. Thus, the capacity for effective action is pervaded by momentariness.

original: nanvevaṃ anvayamātramastu vipakṣāt punarekāntena vyāvṛttiriti kuto labhyamiti cet /
analyzed: nanu evam anvaya mātram astu vipakṣāt punar ekāntena vyāvṛttiḥ iti kutas labhyam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that in this way, let there be mere positive concomitance, but how is the complete exclusion from the dissimilar instance obtained?

analyzed: vyāpti siddheḥ eva
translated: [It is obtained] from the establishment of the pervasion itself.

analyzed: byatireka sandehe vyāpti siddhiḥ eva katham iti ced
translated: If it is asked how the establishment of the pervasion is possible when there is doubt about the negative concomitance,

original: na dvividhā hi vyāptisiddhiranvayarūpā ca karttṛdharmmaḥ /
analyzed: na dvividhā hi vyāpti siddhiḥ anvaya rūpā ca karttṛ dharmmaḥ
translated: [the answer is:] because the establishment of the pervasion is of two kinds. It is of the nature of positive concomitance, which is a property of the subject,

analyzed: sādhana dharmmavati dharmmiṇi sādhya dharmmasya avaśyambhāvaḥ yaḥ
translated: and it is the necessary presence of the property to be established in the subject where the property of the proof is present.

original: vyatirekarūpā ca karmmadharmmaḥ sādhyābhāve sādhanasyāvaśyamabhāvo yaḥ /
analyzed: vyatireka rūpā ca karmma dharmmaḥ sādhya abhāve sādhanasya avaśyam abhāvaḥ yaḥ
translated: And it is of the nature of negative concomitance, which is a property of the object, and it is the necessary absence of the proof when the probandum is absent.

analyzed: enayoḥ ca ekatara pratīti niyamena dvitīya pratītim ākṣipati
translated: And the cognition of one of these necessarily implies the cognition of the other.

analyzed: anyathā ekasyāḥ eva siddhaḥ
translated: Otherwise, only one would be established.

analyzed: tasmāt
translated: Therefore,

original: yathā viparyyaye bādhakapramāṇabalāt niyamavati vyatireke siddhe anvayaviṣayaḥ saṃśayaḥ pūrvvaṃ sthito 'pi paścātparigalati /
analyzed: yathā viparyyaye bādhaka pramāṇa balāt niyamavati vyatireke siddhe anvaya viṣayaḥ saṃśayaḥ pūrvvam paścāt parigalati
translated: For example, when the existence of a necessary relation in the case of the vyatireka is established by the force of a valid cognition that contradicts the contrary, the doubt regarding the anvaya, though previously present, later dissolves away.

analyzed: tatas nvaya prasādhana artham na pṛthak sādhanam ucyate
translated: Therefore, a separate proof is not stated for the sake of establishing the anvaya.

original: tathā prasaṅgatadviparyyayahetudvayabalato niyamavatyanvaye siddhe vyatirekaviṣaye pūrvvaṃ sthito 'pi sandehaḥ paścātparigalatyeva /
analyzed: tathā prasaṅga tad viparyyaya hetu dvaya balataḥ niyamavati anvaye siddhe vyatireka viṣaye pūrvvam sandehaḥ paścāt parigalati eva
translated: Similarly, when the existence of a necessary relation in the anvaya is established by the force of the two reasons, the prasaṅga and the prasaṅgasādhya, the doubt regarding the vyatireka, though previously present, later dissolves away.

analyzed: na ca vyatireka sādhakam anyat pramāṇam vyaktavyam
translated: And no other valid cognition that establishes the vyatireka needs to be stated.

analyzed: tatas ca sādhya abhāve sādhanasya aikāntikaḥ vyatirekaḥ
translated: And then, in the absence of the probandum, the probans is invariably absent in the vyatireka.

original: sādhane sati sādhyasyāvaśyamanvayo veti na kaścidarthabhedaḥ tadevaṃ viparyyayabādhakapramāṇamantareṇāpi🔽prasaṅgaprasaṅgaviparyyayahetudvayabalāt anvayarūpavyāptisidvau sattvahetoranaikāntikasyābhāvādataḥ
analyzed: sādhane sati sādhyasya avaśyam anvayaḥ vā iti na kaścid artha bhedaḥ tat evam viparyyaya bādhaka pramāṇam antareṇa api  prasaṅga prasaṅga viparyyaya hetu dvaya balāt anvaya rūpa vyāpti sidvau sattva hetoḥ anaikāntikasya abhāvāt atas
translated: And when the probans is present, the probandum is necessarily present in the anvaya. Thus there is no difference in meaning. Thus, even without a valid cognition that contradicts the contrary,🔽when the pervasion in the form of anvaya is established by the force of the two reasons, the prasaṅga and the prasaṅgasādhya, the reason of existence is not inconclusive. Therefore,

analyzed: sādhanāt kṣaṇa bhaṅga sidviḥ anavadyā iti
translated: the establishment of momentariness by this proof is faultless.

analyzed: nanu ca sādhanam idam asidvam
translated: But this proof is unestablished.

analyzed: na hi kāraṇa budhyā kāryyam gṛhyate
translated: For an effect is not apprehended by the cognition of a cause.

analyzed: tasya bhāvi tvāt
translated: Because that [effect] is future.

analyzed: na ca kāryya budhyā kāraṇam
translated: And a cause is not [apprehended] by the cognition of an effect.

analyzed: tasya atīta tvāt  na ca varttamāna grāhiṇā jñānena atīta anāgatayoḥ grahaṇam atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because that [cause] is past.🔽And it is not the case that past and future [objects] are apprehended by a cognition that apprehends the present, because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: na ca pūrvvāparayoḥ kālayorekaḥ pratisandhātāsti kṣaṇabhaṅgabhaṅgaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: na ca pūrvva aparayoḥ kālayoḥ ekaḥ pratisandhātā asti kṣaṇa bhaṅga bhaṅga prasaṅgāt
translated: And there is no single unifier of the earlier and later moments, because that would lead to the absurd consequence of the destruction of momentariness.

analyzed: kāraṇa abhāve tu kāryya abhāva pratītiḥ sva sambedana vādinaḥ manorathasya api aviṣayaḥ
translated: But the cognition of the non-existence of an effect in the absence of a cause is not even the object of the wish of one who maintains the doctrine of self-awareness.

original: na ca pūrbbotarakālayoḥ sambittī tābhyāṃ vāsanā tayā ca hetuphalāvasāyī vikalpa iti yuktaṃ /
analyzed: na ca pūrbba utara kālayoḥ sambittī tābhyām vāsanā tayā ca hetu phala avasāyī vikalpaḥ iti yuktam
translated: And it is not reasonable that there is a latent impression from the two cognitions of the earlier and later times, and that the conceptual cognition that ascertains cause and effect arises from that.

original: sa hi vikalpo gṛhītānusandhāyako 'tadrūpasamāropako vā na prathamaḥ pakṣaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi vikalpaḥ tad rūpa samāropakaḥ vā na prathamaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: For that conceptual cognition either recollects what was previously apprehended or superimposes a form that is not that [of the object]. The first case is not correct.

analyzed: ekasya pratisandhātuḥ abhāve pūrvva apara grahaṇayoḥ ayogāt
translated: Because in the absence of a single unifier, the apprehension of the earlier and later [moments] is not possible.

analyzed: vikalpa vāsanāyāḥ eva abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no latent impression of conceptual cognition itself.

analyzed: na api dvitīyaḥ
translated: Nor is the second [correct].

analyzed: marīcikāyām api jala vijñāna prāmāṇya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the absurd consequence that the cognition of water in a mirage would be valid.

analyzed: tat evam anvaya vyatirekayoḥ apratipatteḥ arthakriyā lakṣaṇam sattvam asidvam iti
translated: Thus, since concomitance and non-concomitance are not established, the existence characterized by practical efficiency is not established.

analyzed: kiñca prakāra antarāt api idam sādhanam asidvam
translated: Moreover, this proof is not established even from another point of view.

original: tathā hi vījādīnāṃ sāmarthyaṃ vījādijñānāt kāryyādaṅkurādervā niścetavyaṃ /
analyzed: tathā hi vīja ādīnām sāmarthyam vīja ādi jñānāt kāryyāt aṅkura ādeḥ vā niścetavyam
translated: Thus, the potentiality of seeds and so on should be ascertained either from the knowledge of seeds and so on or from the effect such as a sprout.

analyzed: kāryya tvam ca vastu tva sidvau sidhyati
translated: And being an effect is established when the existence of a thing is established.

analyzed: vastu tvam ca kāryya antarāt
translated: And existence is from another effect.🔽The being an effect of another effect is also established when the existence of a thing is established.

analyzed: tad vastu tvañca tad apara kāryya antarāt iti anavasthā
translated: And that existence of a thing is from another effect of that, so there is an infinite regress.

analyzed: atha anavasthā bhayāt paryyante kāryya antaram na apekṣate
translated: But if at the end one does not depend on another effect out of fear of an infinite regress,

analyzed: tadā tena eva pūrvveṣām asattva prasaṅgāt na ekasya api arthakriyā sāmarthyam sidhyati
translated: then by that very [fact] the non-existence of the previous [effects] follows, and the capacity for practical efficiency of even one [effect] is not established.

analyzed: nanu kāryya tva sattvayoḥ bhinna vyāvṛttika tvāt
translated: But since being an effect and existence have different exclusions,

analyzed: sattā sidvau api kāryya tva sidvau kā kṣatiḥ iti ced
translated: what harm is there in establishing being an effect when existence is established?

analyzed: tat asaṅgatam
translated: That is irrelevant.

analyzed: sati api kāryya tva sattvayoḥ vyāvṛtti bhede sattva sidvau kutas kāryya tva siddhiḥ
translated: Even though being an effect and existence have different exclusions, how is being an effect established when existence is established?

analyzed: kāryya tvam hi a bhūtvā abhāvi tvam
translated: For being an effect means not having existed before.

analyzed: bhavanam ca sattā
translated: And existence is being.

analyzed: sattā ca saugatānām sāmarthyam eva
translated: And being, for the Buddhists, is just capacity.

original: tataśca sāmarthyasandehe bhavatītyeva vaktumaśakyaṃ kathamabhūtvābhāvitvaṃ kāryyatvaṃ setsyati /
analyzed: tatas ca sāmarthya sandehe bhavati iti eva vaktum aśakyam katham a bhūtvā abhāvi tvam kāryya tvam setsyati
translated: And therefore, when capacity is doubtful, it is impossible to say it exists. How then will the fact of not having existed before be established as being an effect?

original: apekṣitaparavyāpāratvaṃ kāryyatvamityapi nāsato dharmmaḥ sattvañca sāmarthyaṃ tacca sandigdhamiti kutaḥ kāryyasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: apekṣita para vyāpāra tvam kāryya tvam iti api na asataḥ dharmmaḥ sattvam ca sāmarthyam tat ca sandigdham iti kutas kāryya siddhiḥ
translated: And even if it is said that being an effect means being dependent on another's operation, that is not a property of what does not exist. And being is capacity, and that is doubtful. So how can the effect be established?

original: tadasidvau pūrvvasya sāmarthyaṃ na sidhyatīti sandigdhāsidvo hetuḥ /
analyzed: tad asidvau pūrvvasya sāmarthyam na sidhyati iti sandigdha asidvaḥ hetuḥ
translated: When that is not established, the previous capacity is not established. Therefore the reason is doubtful and not established.

analyzed: tathā virudvaḥ pi ayam
translated: In the same way, this [reason] is contradictory.

original: tathā hi kṣaṇikatve sati na tāvat ajātasyānanvayanirudvasya vā kāryyārambhakatvaṃ sambhavati /
analyzed: tathā hi kṣaṇika tve sati na tāvat ajātasya ananvaya nirudvasya vā kāryya ārambhaka tvam sambhavati
translated: For thus, if [things] are momentary, first, the production of an effect by what has not arisen or by what has ceased is not possible.

original: na ca nispannasya tāvān kṣaṇo 'sti yamupādāya kasmaicit kāryyāya vyāpāryyet /
analyzed: na ca nispannasya tāvān kṣaṇaḥ asti yam upādāya kasmaicid kāryyāya vyāpāryyet
translated: And for what has been produced, there is not even that much time by which it could be made to operate for some effect.

analyzed: atas kṣaṇika pakṣe eva arthakriyā anupapatteḥ virūdva tā
translated: Therefore, because the performance of an operation is not possible on the side of the momentary [view], [the reason] is contradictory.

analyzed: athavā vikalpena yat upanīyate
translated: Or rather, whatever is brought up by option,

analyzed: tat sarvvam avastu
translated: all that is unreal.

analyzed: tatas ca vastu ātmake kṣaṇikatve sādhye vastu upasthāpayan anumāna vikalpaḥ virudvaḥ
translated: And then, when momentariness belonging to the nature of an entity is to be proved, the inferential conceptual cognition, which presents a non-entity, is contradictory.

original: yadvā / sarvvasyaiva hetoḥ kṣaṇikatve sādhye virudvatvaṃ deśakālāntarānanugame sādhyasādhanabhāvābhāvāt anugame ca nānākālamekamakṣaṇikaṃ kṣaṇikatvena 🔽virudhyata iti /
analyzed: yat vā sarvvasya eva hetoḥ kṣaṇika tve sādhye virudva tvam deśa kāla antara ananugame sādhya sādhana bhāva abhāvāt anugame ca nānākālam ekam akṣaṇikam kṣaṇika tvena  virudhyate iti
translated: Or, for all reasons, when momentariness is to be proved, there is contradiction, because the relation of probandum and probans does not exist when there is no extension to other places and times, and when there is extension, the non-momentary, which is of many times, is contradicted by momentariness.

analyzed: anaikāntikaḥ pi ayam sattva sthairyyayoḥ virodha abhāvāt iti
translated: And this is inconclusive, because there is no contradiction between existence and stability.

analyzed: pratra ucyate
translated: To this it is said.

analyzed: yat tāvat uktam sāmarthyam na pratīyate iti
translated: As for what was said that capability is not cognized,

analyzed: tat kim sarvvathā eva na pratīyate
translated: is it not cognized at all?

analyzed: kṣaṇabhaṅga pakṣe vā
translated: Or in the case of momentariness?
In the first case, because the entire cycle of causes and indicators of actions would be cut off, there would be the absurd consequence that even the mere movement of the mouth would not be done.

original: anyathā yenaiva vacanena sāmarthyaṃ nāstīti pratipādyate tasyaiva tat pratipādanasāmarthyamavyāhatamāyātam /
analyzed: anyathā yena eva vacanena sāmarthyam na asti iti pratipādyate tasya eva tat pratipādana sāmarthyam avyāhatam āyātam
translated: Otherwise, by the very statement by which it is shown that there is no capability, the capability of that very [statement] to convey that [meaning] remains unobstructed.

analyzed: tasmāt parama puruṣa artha samīhayā vastu tattva nirūpaṇa pravṛttasya śakti svīkāra pūrvvakā eva pravṛttiḥ
translated: Therefore, one who is engaged in determining the truth of reality with the desire for the highest human goal, his engagement is only preceded by the acceptance of potency.

original: tadasvīkāre tu na kaścit kvacit pravartteteti nirīhaṃ jagajjāyate /
analyzed: tad asvīkāre tu na kaścid kvacid pravartteta iti nirīham jagat jāyate
translated: If that is not accepted, then no one would engage anywhere, and the world would arise without any activity.

analyzed: atha dvitīyaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: Now, if the second alternative is accepted,

analyzed: tadā asti tāvat sāmarthya pratītiḥ
translated: then the cognition of potentiality exists to some extent.

original: sā ca kṣaṇikatve yadi nopapadyate tadā virudvaṃ vaktumucitaṃ /
analyzed: sā ca kṣaṇika tve yadi na upapadyate tadā virudvam vaktum ucitam
translated: And if that is not possible in the case of momentariness, then it is proper to state what is contradictory.

analyzed: asidvam iti tu nyāyabhūṣaṇīyaḥ prāyovilāpaḥ
translated: But not established is a mere lamentation that is mostly an ornament of logic.

analyzed: na ca sati api kṣaṇika tve sāmarthya pratīti vyāghātaḥ
translated: And even if momentariness exists, there is no contradiction in the cognition of potentiality.

original: tathāhi kāraṇajñānopādeyabhūtena kāryyagrāhiṇā jñānena tadarpitasaṃskāragarbheṇa asya bhāve asya bhāva iti anvayaniścayo janyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kāraṇa jñāna upādeya bhūtena kāryya grāhiṇā jñānena tad arpita saṃskāra garbheṇa asya bhāve asya bhāve iti anvaya niścayaḥ janyate
translated: This is how it is: by the cognition that apprehends the effect, which is to be accepted on the basis of the knowledge of the cause, and which is impregnated with the impressions deposited by that, the ascertainment of the positive concomitance, when this exists, that exists, is produced.

original: tathā kāraṇāpekṣayā bhūtalakaivalyagrāhijñānopādeyabhūtena kāryyāpekṣayā bhūtalakaivalyagrāhiṇā jñānena tadarpitasaṃskāragarbhaṇa asyābhāve
analyzed: tathā kāraṇa apekṣayā bhūtala kaivalya grāhi jñāna upādeya bhūtena kāryya apekṣayā bhūtala kaivalya grāhiṇā jñānena tad arpita saṃskāra garbhaṇa asya abhāve
translated: Similarly, by the cognition that apprehends the mere ground in relation to the cause, which is to be accepted on the basis of the cognition that apprehends the mere ground in relation to the effect, and which is impregnated with the impressions deposited by that, the ascertainment of the negative concomitance,

analyzed: asya abhāvaḥ iti vyatireka niścayaḥ janyate
translated: when this does not exist, that does not exist, is produced.

analyzed: yat āhuḥ guravaḥ  eka avasāya samanantara jātam anya vijñānam anvaya vimarṣam upādadhāti
translated: As the teachers say:🔽The other cognition that arises immediately after the ascertainment of one thing brings about the ascertainment of concomitance.

analyzed: evam tad eka viraha anubhava udbhava anya vyāvṛtta dhīḥ prathayati vyatireka buddhim
translated: Thus, the cognition that is produced from the experience of the absence of one thing manifests the cognition of the absence of another thing.

analyzed: evam sati gṛhīta anusandhāyake eva ayam vikalpaḥ
translated: In this case, this conceptual cognition is only the recollection of what was grasped.

analyzed: upādāna upādeya bhūta krami pratyakṣa dvaya gṛhīta anusandhānāt
translated: Because it is the recollection of the two successive perceptions that grasp what is taken up and what is to be taken up.

analyzed: yat āha alaṅkāraḥ
translated: As Alaṅkāra says:

analyzed: yadi nāma ekam adhyakṣam na pūrvva apara vittimat
translated: If indeed a single perception does not know the prior and subsequent,

analyzed: adhyakṣa dvaya sadbhāve prāc parāvedanam katham iti
translated: how is there the knowledge of the prior and subsequent when two perceptions exist?

analyzed: nā api dvitīyaḥ sidva prabhedaḥ
translated: Nor is the second type of unestablished [reason] [applicable].

analyzed: sāmarthyam hi sattvam iti saugatānām sthitiḥ eṣā
translated: For the Sautrāntikas, existence is indeed potentiality - this is their position.

analyzed: na ca etat prasādhana artham asmākam idānīm eva prārambhaḥ
translated: And this is not our undertaking now just for the sake of establishing that.

original: kintu yatra pramāṇapratīte vījādau vastubhūte dharmmiṇi pramāṇapratītaṃ sāmarthya tatra kṣaṇābhaṅga sādhanāya /
analyzed: kintu yatra pramāṇa pratīte vīja ādau vastu bhūte dharmmiṇi pramāṇa pratītam sāmarthya tatra sādhanāya
translated: But rather, where the property-possessor, such as a seed, which is established by a means of knowledge and is a real entity, has potentiality that is established by a means of knowledge, there [we undertake this] for the sake of establishing momentariness.

analyzed: tatas ca aṅkura ādīnām kāryyāt aśanāt āhatya sāmarthya sandehe pi paṭu pratyakṣa prasidvam sanmātra tvam avadhāryyam eva
translated: And then, since the effect such as the sprout is not perceived, even though there is doubt about the capacity of the seed etc. due to the absence of the effect, mere existence which is well-known through sharp perception should be ascertained.

original: anyathā na kvacidapi vastumātrasyāpi pratipattiḥ syāt /
analyzed: anyathā na kvacid api vastu mātrasya api pratipattiḥ syāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be no ascertainment of mere existence anywhere.

original: tasmācchāstrīyasattvalakṣaṇasandehe 'pi paṭupratyakṣavalāvalambitavastubhāve aṅkurādau kāryyatvamupalabhyamānaṃ vījādeḥ sāmarthyamupasthāpayatīti
analyzed: tasmāt śāstrīya sattva lakṣaṇa sandehe pi paṭu pratyakṣa vala avalambita vastu bhāve aṅkura ādau kāryyatvam upalabhyamānam vīja ādeḥ sāmarthyam upasthāpayati iti
translated: Therefore, even when there is doubt about the characteristic of existence taught in the scriptures, when the nature of an entity is supported by the power of sharp perception, when the effect is perceived in the sprout etc., it establishes the capacity of the seed etc.

analyzed: na asi dvi doṣa avakāśaḥ
translated: Thus, there is no scope for the fault of non-establishment.

analyzed: nā api kśaṇika tve sāmarthya kṣatiḥ
translated: Nor is there any impairment of capacity in momentariness.

analyzed: yatas virudva tā syāt
translated: Because there would be contradiction.
Because there is no contradiction between momentariness and the characteristic of being the invariable antecedent of the effect.

analyzed: kṣaṇa mātra sthāyini api sāmarthya sambhavāt iti na ādimaḥ virodhaḥ
translated: Because capacity is possible even in what lasts for a moment, there is no initial contradiction.

analyzed: nā api dvitīyaḥ virodha prabhedaḥ
translated: Nor is there a second type of contradiction.

analyzed: avastunaḥ vastunaḥ vā su ākārasya grāhya tve pi
translated: Even when the form of a non-entity or an entity is grasped,

original: adhyavaseyavastvapekṣayaiva sarvvatra prāmāṇyapratipādanāt vastusvabhāvasyaiva kṣaṇikatvasidviriti kva virodhaḥ /
analyzed: adhyavaseya vastu apekṣayā eva sarvvatra prāmāṇya pratipādanāt vastu svabhāvasya eva kṣaṇika tva sidviḥ iti kva virodhaḥ
translated: because the validity of everything is established only in relation to the object to be ascertained, and because the nature of an entity is established as momentary, where is there a contradiction?

original: yacca gṛhyate yaccādhyavasīyate te dve api anyanivṛttī na vastunī svalakṣaṇāvagāhitve abhilāpasaṃsargānupapatteriti cet / na /🔽adhyavasāyasvarūpāparijñānāt agṛhīte 'pi vastuni mānasyādipravṛttikārakatvaṃ vikalpasyādhyavasāyitvaṃ /
analyzed: yat ca gṛhyate yat ca adhyavasīyate te dve api anya nivṛttī na vastunī sva lakṣaṇa avagāhi tve abhilāpa saṃsarga anupapatteḥ iti ced na  adhyavasāya svarūpa aparijñānāt agṛhīte vastuni mānasya ādi pravṛtti kāraka tvam vikalpasya adhyavasāyi tvam
translated: If it be said that the two, the object apprehended and the object determined, are not real entities, but only the exclusion of other things, because there can be no connection of verbal expression with the apprehension of the specific individuality? It is not so.🔽Because of the non-understanding of the nature of determination. Even when the object is not apprehended, the vikalpa's being the cause of the activity of the mind etc. is its being determined.

analyzed: apratibhāse pi pravṛtti viṣayīkṛta tvam adhyavaseya tvam
translated: Even when there is no manifestation, being the object of activity is being determined.

analyzed: etat ca adhyavaseya tvam sva lakṣaṇasya eva yujyate na anyasya
translated: And this being determined is proper only for the specific individuality, not for anything else.

analyzed: artha kriyā arthi tvāt arthi pravṛtteḥ
translated: Because the activity of the seeker is for the sake of the accomplishment of the purpose.

analyzed: evam ca adhyavasāye sva lakṣaṇasya asphuraṇam eva
translated: And thus in determination, the specific individuality does not appear.

analyzed: na ca tasya asphuraṇe sarvvatra aviśeṣeṇa pravṛtti ākṣepa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And even when it does not appear, there is no possibility of activity being projected without distinction everywhere.

analyzed: pratiniyata sāmagrī prasūtāt  pratiniyata su ākārāt
translated: Because it arises from a specific assemblage.🔽From a specific form of its own.

analyzed: pratiniyata śakti yogāt
translated: From a specific connection with power.

analyzed: pratiniyate eva a tad rūpa parāvṛtte apratīte pi pravṛtti sāmarthya darśanāt
translated: Because even when a specific thing, which is the exclusion of what is not that, is not apprehended, the capacity for activity is seen.

original: yathā sarvvasyāsattve 'pi vījādaṅkurasyaivotpattiḥ dṛṣṭasya niyatahetuphalabhāvasya pratikṣeptumaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: yathā sarvvasya asattve pi vījāt aṅkurasya eva utpattiḥ dṛṣṭasya niyata hetu phala bhāvasya pratikṣeptum aśakya tvāt
translated: Just as, even in the absence of everything, the production of the sprout only from the seed is seen, because the relation of cause and effect, which is determined, cannot be denied.

original: paraṃ vāhyenārthena sati pratibandhe prāmāṇyamanyathātvaprāmāṇyamiti viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: param vāhyena arthena sati pratibandhe prāmāṇyam anyathātva prāmāṇyam iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: But the difference is that when there is an external object, there is validity when there is a connection, otherwise there is no validity.

analyzed: tathā tṛtīyaḥ pi pakṣaḥ prayāsa phalaḥ
translated: Similarly, the third position is also fruitful.

original: nānākālasyaikasya vastuno vastuto 'sambhavepyatadrūpaparāvṛttayoreva sādhyasādhanayoḥ pratyakṣeṇa vyāptigrahaṇāt /
analyzed: nānā kālasya ekasya vastunaḥ sambhave pya tad rūpa parāvṛttayoḥ eva sādhya sādhanayoḥ pratyakṣeṇa vyāpti grahaṇāt
translated: Even though a single thing at different times is not really possible, the pervasion between the object to be established and the means of establishment, which are both excluded from what is not their form, is grasped by perception.

original: dvividho hi pratyakṣasya viṣayo grāhyo 'dhyavaseyaśca sakalātadrūpaparāvṛttaṃ vastumātraṃ sākṣādasphuraṇāt pratyakṣasya grāhyo viṣayo mā bhūt
analyzed: dvividhaḥ hi pratyakṣasya viṣayaḥ grāhyaḥ dhyavaseyaḥ ca sakala a tad rūpa parāvṛttam vastu mātram sākṣāt asphuraṇāt pratyakṣasya grāhyaḥ viṣayaḥ mā
translated: For there are two kinds of objects of perception: the grasped and the inferred. The mere thing, which is completely turned away from what is not itself, is not directly manifested, so let the object of perception not be the grasped object.

analyzed: tad eka deśa grahaṇe tu tanmātrayoḥ vyāpti niścāyaka vikalpa jananāt adhyavaseyaḥ viṣayaḥ bhavati eva  kṣaṇa grahaṇe santāna niścaya vat
translated: But when a part of it is grasped, then the object is indeed the inferred object, because it generates the conceptual thought that ascertains the pervasion of just that.🔽Like the ascertainment of a continuum when a moment is grasped.

analyzed: rūpa mātra grahaṇe ghaṭa niścaya vat ca
translated: And like the ascertainment of a pot when only the form is grasped.

analyzed: anyathā sarvva anumāna uccheda prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the undesirable consequence of the destruction of all inference.

analyzed: tathā hi vyāpti grahaḥ sāmānyayoḥ
translated: For, the apprehension of the pervasion is of two universals,

analyzed: viśeṣayoḥ
translated: of two particulars,

analyzed: sāmānya viśiṣṭa viśeṣayoḥ viśeṣa viśiṣṭa sāmānyayoḥ vā iti vikalpāḥ
translated: or of a particular qualified by a universal or of a universal qualified by a particular.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ vikalpaḥ sāmānyasya vādhya tvāt
translated: The first alternative is not correct, because the universal is what is to be inferred.

analyzed: avādhya tve pi adṛśya tvāt
translated: Even if it is not to be inferred, it is not perceived.

analyzed: dṛśya tve pi puruṣa artha anupayogi tayā tasya anumeya tva ayogāt
translated: Even if it is perceived, it is not proper to infer it because it is not useful for human goals.

analyzed: na api anumitāt sāmānyāt viśeṣa anumānam
translated: Nor is the inference of a particular from an inferred universal.

analyzed: sāmānya sarvva viśeṣayoḥ vakṣyamāṇa nyāyena pratibandha pratipatteḥ ayogāt
translated: Because, as will be explained later, the relation between a universal and all particulars is not proper.

analyzed: nā api dvitīyaḥ viśeṣasya ananugāmi tvāt
translated: Nor is the second alternative, because the particular is not pervasive.

original: antime tu vikalpadvaye sāmānyādhāratayā dṛṣṭa eva viśeṣaḥ sāmānyasya viśeṣyo viśeṣaṇaṃ vā karttavyaḥ /
analyzed: antime tu vikalpa dvaye sāmānya ādhāra tayā dṛṣṭaḥ eva viśeṣaḥ sāmānyasya viśeṣyaḥ viśeṣaṇam vā karttavyaḥ
translated: But in the last two alternatives, only the particular that is seen as the substratum of the universal should be made the object or the qualifier of the universal.

analyzed: a dṛṣṭaḥ eva vā deśa kāla antara varttī
translated: Or it is unseen, existing in a different place and time.

original: yadvā dṛṣṭādṛṣṭātmako deśakālāntarabartī atadrūpaparāvṛttaḥ sarvvo viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: yat vā dṛṣṭa adṛṣṭa ātmakaḥ deśa kāla antara bartī a tad rūpa parāvṛttaḥ sarvvaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: Or all particulars, consisting of the seen and unseen, existing in a different place and time, are turned away from that form.

analyzed: na prathamaḥ pakṣaḥ nanugāmi ttvāt
translated: The first alternative is not correct because it is not pervasive.

analyzed: na api dvitīyaḥ
translated: Nor is the second.

analyzed: a dṛṣṭa tvāt
translated: Because it is unseen.

analyzed: na ca tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Nor is the third.

analyzed: prastuta eka viśeṣa darśane pi deśa kāla antara varttinām adarśanāt
translated: Even when a particular is directly perceived, other particulars existing in different places and times are not perceived.

original: atha teṣāṃ sarvveṣāmeva viśeṣāṇāṃ sadṛśatvāt /🔽sadṛśasāmagrīprasūtatvāt sadṛśakāryyakāritvāditi prattyāsattyā /
analyzed: atha teṣām sarvveṣām eva viśeṣāṇām sadṛśa tvāt  sadṛśa sāmagrī prasūta tvāt sadṛśa kāryya kāri tvāt iti prattyāsattyā
translated: Or, because all those particulars are similar.🔽Because they are produced by a similar assemblage of causes, because they produce a similar effect, by association.

analyzed: eka viśeṣa grāhakam pratyakṣam a tad rūpa parāvṛtta mātre niścayam janayat a tad rūpa parāvṛtta viśeṣa mātrasya vyavasthāpakam
translated: Perception, which grasps a particular, produces a definite cognition of mere exclusion from what is not of that form, and thus establishes mere exclusion from what is not of that form.

analyzed: yathā eka sāmagrī pratibadva rūpa mātra grāhakam pratyakṣam ghaṭe niścayam janayat ghaṭa grāhakam byavasthāpyate
translated: Just as perception, which grasps mere form obstructed by a single assemblage of conditions, produces a definite cognition of the pot, and thus is established as the apprehender of the pot.

original: anyathā ghaṭo 'pi ghaṭasantāno 'pi pratyakṣato na sidhyet sarvvātmanā grahaṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: anyathā ghaṭaḥ pi ghaṭa santānaḥ pi pratyakṣataḥ na sidhyet sarvva ātmanā grahaṇa abhāvāt
translated: Otherwise, even the pot and the continuum of pots would not be established by perception, because there is no grasping of the whole.

analyzed: tad eka deśa grahaṇam tu a tad rūpa parāvṛtte pi a viśiṣṭam
translated: But the grasping of a part is not different even in the case of exclusion from what is not of that form.

original: yadyevamanenaiva krameṇa sarvvasya viśeṣasya viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvavat vyāptipratipattirapyastu /
analyzed: yadi evam anena eva krameṇa sarvvasya viśeṣasya viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāva vat vyāpti pratipattiḥ api astu
translated: If it is so, let the cognition of the pervasion of every particular along with the relation of qualifier and qualified be established by this very process.

original: tat kimarthaṃ nānākālamekakṣaṇikamabhyupagantavyaṃ yena kṣaṇikatve sādhanasya virudvatvaṃ syāt iti na kaścidvirodhaprabhedaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tat kimartham nānā kālam eka kṣaṇikam abhyupagantavyam yena kṣaṇika tve sādhanasya virudva tvam syāt iti na kaścid virodha prabheda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Therefore, why should it be accepted that [an entity] is momentary at different times, so that the proof of momentariness would be contradictory? Thus, there is no possibility of any kind of contradiction.

analyzed: na ca ayam anekāntikaḥ hetuḥ
translated: And this reason is not inconclusive either.
Because the pervasion in the form of concomitance is established by the reasons of reductio ad absurdum and reversal in the example of similar property, according to the previously stated method.

original: nanu yadi prasaṅgaviparyyayahetudvayavalato ghaṭe dṛṣṭānte kṣaṇabhaṅgaḥ sidhyettadā sattvasya niyamena kṣaṇikatvena vyāptisidveranaikāntikatvaṃ
analyzed: nanu yadi prasaṅga viparyaya hetu dvaya valataḥ ghaṭe dṛṣṭānte kṣaṇabhaṅgaḥ sidhyet tadā sattvasya niyamena kṣaṇika tvena vyāpti sidveḥ anaikāntika tvam
translated: If the momentariness is established in the example of the pot by the force of the two reasons of reductio ad absurdum and reversal, then it is correct that [the reason] is not inconclusive because the existence is established as invariably concomitant with momentariness.

analyzed: na syāt iti yuktam  kevala midam eva asambhavi
translated: But this alone is impossible.

original: tathāhi śakto 'pi ghaṭaḥ kramisahakāryyapekṣayā kramikāryyaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi śaktaḥ api ghaṭaḥ krami sahakāri apekṣayā krami kāryyam kariṣyati
translated: Thus, although capable, a pot will produce an effect that arises in sequence by depending on cooperating causes that arise in sequence.

original: na caitad vaktavyaṃ samartho 'rthaḥ svarūpeṇa karoti /
analyzed: na ca etat vaktavyam samarthaḥ rthaḥ sva rūpeṇa karoti
translated: And this should not be said: A capable object produces by its own nature.

original: svarūpañca sarvvadāstītyanupakāriṇi sahakāriṇyapekṣā na yujyata iti /
analyzed: sva rūpam ca sarvvadā asti iti anupakāriṇi sahakāriṇi apekṣā na yujyate iti
translated: And its own nature exists at all times, so dependence on a non-beneficial cooperating cause is not reasonable.

analyzed: sati api svarūpeṇa kāraka tve sāmarthya abhāvāt katham karoti
translated: Even though it has the nature of being a cause, how can it produce [an effect] if it lacks the ability [to do so]?

analyzed: sahakāri sākalyam hi sāmarthyam tad vaikalyam ca asāmarthyam
translated: For ability is the completeness of the cooperating factors, and lack of ability is the incompleteness of the cooperating factors.

original: na ca tayorāvirbhāvatirobhāvābhyāṃ tadvataḥ kācit kṣatiḥ /
analyzed: na ca tayoḥ āvirbhāva tirobhāvābhyām tadvataḥ kācid kṣatiḥ
translated: And the presence or absence of these does not in any way affect that which possesses them.

analyzed: tasya tābhyām anya tvāt
translated: Because that [entity] is different from them.

original: tasmādarthaḥ samartho 'pi syāt na ca karotīti sandigdhavyatirekaḥ prasaṅgahetuḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt arthaḥ samarthaḥ syāt na ca karoti iti sandigdha vyatirekaḥ prasaṅga hetuḥ
translated: Therefore, the reason [that the opponent gives] is inconclusive, since it is possible that an object, even though able, may not produce [its effect].

analyzed: atrā ucyate bhavatu tāvat sahakāri sākalyam eva sāmarthyam
translated: To this we reply: Let it be that the completeness of the cooperating factors is itself the ability [to produce an effect].

original: tathāpi so 'pi tāvadbhāvaḥ svarūpeṇa kārakaḥ /🔽tasya ca yādṛśaścaramakṣaṇe 'kṣepakriyādharmmā svabhāvaḥ tādṛśa eva cet prathamakṣaṇe tadā tadāpi prasahya kurbbāṇo brahmaṇāpyanivāryyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api saḥ pi tāvat bhāvaḥ sva rūpeṇa kārakaḥ  tasya ca yādṛśaḥ carama kṣaṇe kṣepa kriyā dharmmā svabhāvaḥ tādṛśaḥ eva ced prathama kṣaṇe tadā tadā api prasahya kurbbāṇaḥ brahmaṇā api anivāryyaḥ
translated: Even so, that entity is a cause by its own nature.🔽And if its nature, which has the property of projecting [an effect] in the final moment, is exactly the same in the first moment, then it should produce [the effect] forcibly even then, and no one, not even Brahmā, could prevent it.

original: na ca so 'pyakṣepakriyādharmmā svabhāvaḥ sākalye sati jāto bhāvādbhinna evābhidhātuṃ śakyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca saḥ pi akṣepa kriyā dharmmā svabhāvaḥ sākalye sati jātaḥ bhāvāt bhinnaḥ evā abhidhātum śakyaḥ
translated: And that nature which has the property of projecting [an effect] cannot be said to be different from the entity when the completeness [of the cooperating factors] is present.

analyzed: bhāvasya akarttṛ tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would follow absurdly that the entity would not be a cause [if its nature were different].

analyzed: evam yāvat yāvat dharma antara parikalpaḥ tāvat tāvat udāsīnaḥ bhāvaḥ
translated: In the same way, as far as there is the conceptualization of another entity, to that extent there is a neutral entity.

original: tasmādyadrūpamādāya svarūpeṇāpi janayatītyucyate /🔽tasya prāgapi bhāve kathamajaniḥ kadācit /
analyzed: tasmāt yat rūpam ādāya sva rūpeṇa api janayati iti ucyate  tasya prāk api bhāve katham ajaniḥ kadācid
translated: Therefore, it is said that taking that form, it generates even with its own nature.🔽How can it ever be unproduced, even before, when it exists?

original: akṣepakriyāpratyanīkasvabhāvasya prācyasya paścādanuvṛttau kathaṃ kadācidapi kāryyasambhavaḥ /
analyzed: akṣepa kriyā pratyanīka svabhāvasya prācyasya paścāt anuvṛttau katham kadācid api kāryya sambhavaḥ
translated: If the prior nature, which is the opposite of the activity of projection, continues afterwards, how can the effect ever arise?

original: nanu yadi sa evaikaḥ karttā syāt yuktametat /
analyzed: nanu yadi saḥ eva ekaḥ karttā syāt yuktam etat
translated: But if it were the same single agent, this would be appropriate.

original: kintu sāmagrī janikā tataḥ sahakāryyantaravirahavelāyāṃ balīyaso 'pi na kāryyaprasava iti kimatra virudvaṃ /
analyzed: kintu sāmagrī janikā tatas sahakāri antara viraha velāyām balīyasaḥ api na kāryya prasavaḥ iti kim atra virudvam
translated: However, the collection is the producer. Therefore, even at the time of the absence of another cooperating factor, the strong one does not produce the effect. What is contradictory here?

original: na hi bhāvaḥ svarūpeṇakarotīti svarūpeṇaiva karoti /
analyzed: na hi bhāvaḥ sva rūpeṇa karoti iti sva rūpeṇa eva karoti
translated: For a thing does not produce by its own nature. It produces only by its own nature.

analyzed: sahakāri sahitāt eva tatas kāryya utpatti darśanāt
translated: Because the effect is seen to arise only from it together with the cooperating factors.

analyzed: kāryya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ pi
translated: Therefore, like the attainment, the relation of cause and effect is also.

analyzed: ekatra anya yoga vyavacchedena anyatra ayoga vyavacchedena na avabodvavyaḥ
translated: It should not be understood as exclusion of another in one case, and exclusion of non-connection in another case.

analyzed: tathā eva laukika parīkṣakāṇām sampratipatteḥ iti
translated: Because the worldly and the investigators agree in the same way.

original: atrocyate / yadā militāḥ santaḥ kāryyaṃ kurvvate tadaikārthakaraṇalakṣaṇaṃ sahakāritvamepāmastu ko niṣedvā /
analyzed: atrā ucyate yadā militāḥ santaḥ kāryyam kurvvate tadā ekārtha karaṇa lakṣaṇam sahakāri tvam epām astu kaḥ
translated: To this we reply: When they come together and produce an effect, let them have the character of cooperation in producing one effect. Who can object to that?

original: militaireva tu tatkāryya karttavyamiti kuto labhyate /
analyzed: militaiḥ eva tu tat kāryya karttavyam iti kutas labhyate
translated: But how is it known that the effect must be produced only by those that have come together?

analyzed: pūrvva aparayoḥ eka svabhāva tvāt bhāvasya
translated: Because the existence has the same nature in the past and future.

analyzed: sarvvadā janana ajananayoḥ anyatara niyata prasaṅgasya durvvāra tvāt
translated: Because it is difficult to avoid the undesirable consequence of the necessity of either always producing or never producing.

original: tasmāt sāmagrī janika naikaṃ janakamiti sthiravādināṃ manorathasyāpyaviṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sāmagrī janika na ekam janakam iti sthira vādinām manorathasya api aviṣayaḥ
translated: Therefore, the collection is the producer, not a single [factor]. This is not even the object of the wish of those who maintain [the existence of] enduring [entities].

analyzed: dṛśyate tāvat evam iti ced
translated: If it is said that it is seen to be so,

original: dṛśyatāṃ kintu pūrvvasthitādeva sāmagrīmadhyapraviṣṭādbhāvāt kāryotpattiranyasmādeva vā viśiṣṭādbhāvādutpannāditi vivādapadam /
analyzed: dṛśyatām kintu pūrvva sthitāt eva sāmagrī madhya praviṣṭāt bhāvāt kārya utpattiḥ anyasmāt eva vā viśiṣṭāt bhāvāt utpannāt iti vivāda padam
translated: let it be seen. But whether the effect arises from an entity that exists previously and enters the collection, or from a different, special entity that arises, that is the point of dispute.🔽There, even if it were possible before, the effect would either always arise or never arise at all. Without resolving this contradiction, closing the eyes, and saying Because the arising of the effect is seen from that [collection],

original: tatra prāgapi sambhave sarvvadaiva kāryyotpatti rna vā kadācidapīti virodhamasamādhāya cakṣuṣī nimīlya tata eva kāryyotpattidarśanāditi sādhyānuvādamātrapravṛttaḥ
analyzed: tatra prāk api sambhave sarvvadā eva kāryya utpattiḥ na vā kadācid api iti virodham a samādhāya cakṣuṣī nimīlya tatas eva kāryya utpatti darśanāt iti sādhya anuvāda mātra pravṛttaḥ
translated: one engages in mere repetition of the conclusion.

analyzed: kṛpām arhati iti
translated: He deserves compassion.

original: na ca pratyabhijñādibalādekatvasidviḥ tat pauruṣasya lūnapunarjātakeśanakhādāvapyupalambhato nirddalanāt /
analyzed: na ca pratyabhijñā ādi balāt eka tva sidviḥ tat pauruṣasya lūna punar jāta keśa nakha ādau api upalambhataḥ nirddalanāt
translated: And the establishment of oneness by the power of recognition, etc., is not possible, because it is refuted by the observation of hair and nails cut off and grown again in the case of human beings.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa bhedasya ca darśayitum aśakya tvāt
translated: And because the difference in characteristics cannot be shown.

analyzed: sthira sidvi dūṣaṇe ca asmābhiḥ prapañcataḥ nirasta tvāt
translated: And because the refutation of the established permanence has been thoroughly refuted by us.

original: tasmāt sākṣāt kāryyakāraṇabhāvāpekṣayā ubhayatrāpyanyayogavyavacchedaḥ /🔽vyāptau tu sākṣātparamparayā kāraṇamātrāpekṣayā kāraṇe vyāpake 'yogavyavacchedaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sākṣāt kāryya kāraṇa bhāva apekṣayā ubhayatra api anya yoga vyavacchedaḥ  vyāptau tu sākṣāt paramparayā kāraṇa mātra apekṣayā kāraṇe vyāpake yoga vyavacchedaḥ
translated: Therefore, in both cases, the exclusion of other is in relation to the direct relation of cause and effect.🔽But in the case of pervasion, in relation to mere cause directly or indirectly, there is the exclusion of the incompatible in the all-pervading cause.

analyzed: kārye vyāpye nyayoga vyavacchedaḥ
translated: And in the case of the pervaded effect, there is the exclusion of other.

analyzed: tathā tad a tad svabhāve vyāpake yoga vyavacchedaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the all-pervading nature of that and that, there is the exclusion of the incompatible.

original: tatsvabhāve ca vyāpye 'nyayogavyavacchedo vikalpāruḍharūpāpekṣayā vyāptau dvividhamavadhāraṃam /
analyzed: tad svabhāve ca vyāpye vikalpa āruḍha rūpa apekṣayā vyāptau dvividham avadhāraṃam
translated: And in the case of the pervaded nature of that, there is the exclusion of other. This twofold determination in the case of pervasion is in relation to the form that has arisen from conceptual thought.

original: nanu yadi pūrvvāparakālayorekasvabhāvo bhāvaḥ sarvvadājanakatvenājanakatvena vā vyāpta upalabdhaḥ syāttadāyaṃ prasaṅgaḥ saṅgacchate /
analyzed: nanu yadi pūrvva apara kālayoḥ eka svabhāvaḥ bhāvaḥ sarvvadā ajanaka tvena ajanaka tvena vā vyāptaḥ upalabdhaḥ syāt tadā ayam prasaṅgaḥ saṅgacchate
translated: If an entity having the same nature at earlier and later times were apprehended as pervaded by the property of not producing or by the property of not producing at all, then this consequence would be acceptable.

original: na kṣaṇabhaṅgavādinā pūrvvāparakālayorekaḥ kaścidupalabdha iti cet /
analyzed: na kṣaṇabhaṅga vādinā pūrvva apara kālayoḥ ekaḥ kaścid upalabdhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said that for the proponent of momentariness, no single [entity] is perceived in the earlier and later times,

analyzed: tat etat atigrāmyam
translated: this is extremely foolish.

original: tathāhi pūrvvāparakālayorekasvabhāvatve satītyasyāyamarthaḥ /🔽parakālabhāvī janako yaḥ svabhāvo bhāvasya sa eva yadi pūrvvakālabhāvī /
analyzed: tathā hi pūrvva apara kālayoḥ eka svabhāva tve sati iti asya ayam arthaḥ  para kāla bhāvī janakaḥ yaḥ svabhāvaḥ bhāvasya saḥ eva yadi pūrvva kāla bhāvī
translated: For this is the meaning of [the statement] if [the entity] has a single nature in the earlier and later times:🔽if the very nature that exists in the later time and is productive is the same as that which exists in the earlier time,

original: pūrvvakālabhāvī vā yo 'janakaḥ svabhāvaḥ sa eva yadi parakālabhāvī /
analyzed: pūrvva kāla bhāvī vā yaḥ janakaḥ svabhāvaḥ saḥ eva yadi para kāla bhāvī
translated: or if the very nature that exists in the earlier time and is non-productive is the same as that which exists in the later time,

analyzed: tadā upalabdham eva jananam ajananam bā syāt
translated: then production or non-production would be perceived [to occur] at the very same time.

original: tathā ca sati sidvayoreva svabhāvayorekatvārope sidvameva jananamajananambāsajyata iti /
analyzed: tathā ca sati sidvayoḥ eva svabhāvayoḥ ekatva ārope sidvam eva jananam ajananam bā āsajyate iti
translated: And if that were so, then the very production or non-production would be superimposed on the very two established natures [as identical].

analyzed: nanu kāryyam eva sahakāriṇam apekṣate
translated: But doesn't the effect itself require the cooperating factors?

original: na tu kāryyotpattihetuḥ /🔽yasmāt dvividhaṃ sāmarthya nijamāgantukañca sahakāryyantaraṃ tato 'kṣaṇikasyāpi kramavat
analyzed: na tu kāryya utpatti hetuḥ  yasmāt dvividham sāmarthya nijam āgantukam ca sahakāri antaram kṣaṇikasya api krama vat
translated: But not the cause of the production of the effect.

original: sahakārinānātvādapi kramavat kāryyanānātvopapatteraśakyaṃ bhāvānāṃ pratikṣaṇamanyānyatvamupapādayitumiti cet /
analyzed: sahakāri nānātvāt api krama vat kāryya nānātva upapatteḥ aśakyam bhāvānām pratikṣaṇam anya anyatvam upapādayitum iti ced
translated: Because there are two kinds of power: inherent and adventitious. From that, even for the non-momentary, due to the diversity of cooperating factors occurring in sequence, the diversity of effects also occurs in sequence. Therefore, it is impossible to establish the momentariness of entities. If it is said that the momentariness of entities is to be established by the fact that the effect is not seen to be produced at all times, even though the cause is present, because the effect requires cooperating factors,

analyzed: ucyate
translated: it is said:

analyzed: bhavatu tāvat nija āgantuka bhedena dvividham sāmarthyam
translated: Let it be that there are two kinds of power, divided into inherent and adventitious.

original: tathāpi yat prātisvikaṃ vastusvalakṣaṇaṃ arthakriyādharmmakamavaśyamabhyupagantavyaṃ tat kiṃ prāgapi paścādeva veti vikalpya yaddūṣaṇamugdīritaṃ
analyzed: tathā api yat prātisvikam vastu sva lakṣaṇam arthakriyā dharmmakam avaśyam abhyupagantavyam tat kim prāk api paścāt eva vā iti vikalpya yat dūṣaṇam ugdīritam
translated: Even so, the objection that is raised, by supposing that the individual specific property of an entity, which is necessarily admitted to be capable of effective action, is either prior or subsequent,

analyzed: tatra kim uktam anena iti na pratīmaḥ
translated: we do not understand what is meant by this.

original: yattu kāryyeṇaiva sahakāriṇo 'pekṣanta ityupatkṛtaṃ tadapi nirupayogaṃ /
analyzed: yat tu kāryyeṇa eva upekṣante iti upatkṛtam tat api nirupayogam
translated: And what is stated, that they require auxiliaries only through the effect, that also is useless.

original: yadi hi kāryyameva svajanmani svatantraṃ syādyuktametat /🔽kevalamevaṃ sati sahakārisākalyasāmarthyakalpanamaphalaṃ /
analyzed: yadi hi kāryyam eva sva janmani svatantram syāt yuktam etat  kevalam evam sati sahakāri sākalya sāmarthya kalpanam aphalam
translated: For if the effect itself were independent in its own production, this would be proper.🔽But if it is only so, then the assumption of the capacity of the completeness of auxiliaries is fruitless.

analyzed: svātantryāt eva hi kāryyam kādācitkam bhaviṣyati
translated: For the effect will be occasional just by its independence.

original: tathā ca sati santo hetavaḥ sarvvathāsamarthāḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca sati santaḥ hetavaḥ sarvvathā asamarthāḥ
translated: And if it is so, then the existing causes are entirely incapable.

analyzed: asat etat kāryyam svatantram iti viśuddhā budviḥ
translated: This is not correct, that the effect is independent. The pure understanding is that.

original: atha kāryyasyaivāyamaparādho yadidaṃ samarthe kāraṇe satyapi kadācinnopapadyata iti cet /
analyzed: atha kāryyasya eva ayam aparādhaḥ yat idam samarthe kāraṇe sati api kadācid nā upapadyate iti ced
translated: If it is said that this is the fault of the effect itself, that even when the capable cause exists, it sometimes does not occur,

analyzed: na tat tarhi tat kāryyam svātantryāt
translated: then it is not the effect of that, because of its independence.

analyzed: yat bhāṣyam
translated: As stated in the commentary:

analyzed: sarvva avasthā samāne pi kāraṇe yadi akāryya tā
translated: Even if the cause is the same in all states, if there is non-production,

original: svatantraṃ kāryyamevaṃ syānnatatkāryyantathā sati //🔽atha na tadbhāve bhavatīti tatkāryyamucyate /
analyzed: svatantram kāryyam evam syāt na tat kāryyam tathā sati  atha na tad bhāve bhavati iti tat kāryyam ucyate
translated: the effect would be independent. If that is so, it is not its effect.🔽If it is said that it is called the effect of that because it does not exist when that exists,

original: kintu tadabhāvena bhavatyeveti vyatirekaprādhānyāditi cet / na /
analyzed: kintu tad abhāvena bhavati eva iti vyatireka prādhānyāt iti ced na
translated: but it exists only when that does not exist, because the absence is primary, that is not so.

original: yadi hi svayambhavan bhāvayedeva hetuḥ svakāryyaṃ tadā tadabhāvaprayukto 'syābhāva iti pratītiḥ syāt /
analyzed: yadi hi svayam bhavan bhāvayet eva hetuḥ sva kāryyam tadā syāt abhāvaḥ iti pratītiḥ syāt
translated: For if the cause, while existing by itself, would produce its own effect, then there would be the cognition that its non-existence is due to the absence of that.

original: no ced yathā kāraṇe satyapi kāryyasvātantryānna bhavati /
analyzed: no ced yathā kāraṇe sati api kāryya svātantryāt na bhavati
translated: If not, then just as it does not exist even when the cause exists because the effect is independent,

original: tathā tadabhāve 'pi svātantryādeva na bhūtamiti śaṅkā kena nivāryyeta /
analyzed: tathā tad abhāve pi svātantryāt eva na bhūtam iti śaṅkā kena nivāryyeta
translated: in the same way, even when that does not exist, it does not exist because of independence itself. By what is the doubt prevented?

analyzed: yat bhāṣyam  tad bhāve pi na bhāvaḥ ced abhāve bhāvi tā kutas
translated: As stated in the commentary:🔽If it does not exist even when that exists, how can it be non-existent when that does not exist?

analyzed: tad abhāva prayuktaḥ asya saḥ bhāvaḥ iti tat kutas
translated: How can it be said that its non-existence is due to the absence of that?

original: tasmād yathaiva tadbhāve niyamena na bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt yathā eva tad bhāve niyamena na bhavati
translated: Therefore, just as it does not exist invariably when that exists,

analyzed: tathā eva tad bhāve niyamena bhavet eva
translated: in the same way, it would exist invariably when that exists.

analyzed: abhavat ca na tad kāraṇa tām ātmanaḥ kṣamate
translated: And having not existed, it cannot bear the status of being its cause.

analyzed: yat ca uktam prathama kāryya utpādana kāle hṛttara kāryya utpādana svabhāvaḥ
translated: And what was said: At the time of producing the first effect, it has the nature of producing the second effect.

analyzed: atas prathama kāle eva aśeṣāṇi kāryyāṇi kuryyāt iti
translated: Therefore, it should produce all the effects at the very first moment.

analyzed: tat idam mātā me vandhyā ityādi vat sva vacana nirodhāt ayuktam
translated: This is unreasonable because it contradicts one's own statement, like saying My mother is barren.

original: yo hṛttarakāryyajananasvabhāvaḥ sa kathamādau kāryyaṃ kuryyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ hṛttara kāryya janana svabhāvaḥ sa katham ādau kāryyam kuryyāt
translated: How could that which has the nature of producing the second effect produce the first effect at the beginning?

original: na tarhi tatkāryyakaraṇasvabhāvaḥ na hi nīlotpādanasvabhāvaḥ pītādikamapi karotīti /
analyzed: na tarhi tad kāryya karaṇa svabhāvaḥ na hi nīla utpādana svabhāvaḥ pīta ādikam api karoti iti
translated: Then it does not have the nature of producing that effect. For that which has the nature of producing the blue does not produce the yellow, etc.

original: atrocyate / sthirasvabhāvatve hi bhāvasya uttarakālamevedaṃ kāryyaṃ na pūrvvakālamiti kuta etat /
analyzed: atrā ucyate sthira svabhāva tve hi bhāvasya uttara kālam eva idam kāryyam na pūrvva kālam iti kutas etat
translated: To this it is said: If the entity has a stable nature, how can it be that this effect is only at a later time and not at an earlier time?

analyzed: tad abhāvāt ca kāraṇam api uttara kāryya karaṇa svabhāvam iti api kutas
translated: And because of that absence, how can the cause also have the nature of producing the subsequent effect?

original: kiṃ kurmmaḥ uttarakālameva tasya janmeti cet /🔽astu sthiratve tadanupapadyamānamasthiratāmādiśatu /
analyzed: kim kurmmaḥ uttara kālam eva tasya janma iti ced  astu sthiratve tat anupapadyamānam asthiratām ādiśatu
translated: If it is said What can we do? Its birth is only at a later time,🔽let it be. When that is not possible due to stability, let it declare instability.

original: sthiṣtvepyeṣa eva svabhāvastasya yaduttarakṣaṇa eva karotīti cet /
analyzed: sthiṣtve pi eṣaḥ eva svabhāvaḥ tasya yat uttara kṣaṇe eva karoti iti ced
translated: If it is said Even in stability, this is its very nature that it produces only at the subsequent moment,

analyzed: uta idānīm pramāṇa pratyāśā
translated: then now there is hope for a valid means of knowledge.

original: dhūmādagnirityatrāpi svabhāva evāsya yadidānīmatra niragnirapi dhūma iti vaktuṃ śakyatvāt /
analyzed: dhūmāt agniḥ iti atra api svabhāvaḥ eva asya yat idānīm atra niragniḥ api dhūmaḥ iti vaktum śakya tvāt
translated: Even in the case of 'fire from smoke', if this were just its nature, it could be said that even now there is smoke here without fire.

analyzed: tasmāt pramāṇa sidve svabhāva avalambanam
translated: Therefore, one relies on the nature that is established by valid cognition.

analyzed: na tu svabhāva avalambanena pramāṇa vyālopaḥ
translated: But one does not abandon valid cognition by relying on nature.

analyzed: tasmāt yadi kāraṇasya uttara kāryya kāraka tvam abhyupagamya kāryyasya prathama kṣaṇa bhāvi tvam āsajyate
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that a cause produces an effect later, and then posits that the effect exists in the first moment,

analyzed: syāt sva vacana virodhaḥ
translated: there would be a contradiction with one's own words.

analyzed: yadā tu kāraṇasya sthira tve kāryyasya uttara kāla tvam eva asaṅgatam
translated: But when the cause is permanent, it is indeed contradictory for the effect to exist at a later time.

analyzed: atas kāraṇasya api uttara kāryya janaka tvam vastutas sambhavi tadā prasaṅga sādhanam idam
translated: Therefore, if the production of an effect by a cause is impossible in reality, then this is a reductio argument.

analyzed: janana vyavahāra gocara tvam hi jananena vyāptam iti prasādhitam
translated: For it has been established that the state of being the object of the convention of production is pervaded by production.

original: uttarakāryyajananavyavahāragocaratvañca tvadabhyupagamāt prathamakāryyakaraṇakāla eva ghaṭe dharmmiṇi sidvaṃ /
analyzed: uttara kāryya janana vyavahāra gocara tvañca tvad abhyupagamāt prathama kāryya karaṇa kāle eva ghaṭe dharmmiṇi sidvam
translated: And the state of being the object of the convention of producing a later effect is established at the time of producing the first effect itself in the subject, the pot, according to your acceptance.

original: atastanmātrānubandhina uttarābhimatasya kāryyasya prathame kṣaṇe 'sambhavādeva prasaṅgaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: atas tanmātra anubandhinaḥ uttara abhimatasya kāryyasya prathame kṣaṇe sambhavāt eva prasaṅgaḥ kriyate
translated: Therefore, the reductio is made just because the effect desired in the future, which is connected only with those [causes], is impossible in the first moment.

original: na hi nīlakārake 'pi pītakārakatvārope pītasambhavaprasaṅgaḥ svavacanavirodhonāma /
analyzed: na hi nīla kārake pi pīta kāraka tva ārope pīta sambhava prasaṅgaḥ sva vacana virodhaḥ nāma
translated: For when the cause of blue is superimposed as the cause of yellow, there is no contradiction of one's own words in the reductio that yellow would arise.

original: tadevaṃ śaktaḥ sahakāryyanapekṣitatvāt jananena vyāptaḥ /🔽ajanayaṃśca śaktāśaktatvavirudvadharmmādhyāsādbhinna eva /
analyzed: tat evam śaktaḥ sahakāri an apekṣita tvāt jananena vyāptaḥ  ajanayan ca śakta aśakta tva virudva dharmma adhyāsāt bhinnaḥ eva
translated: Thus, the capable [cause] is pervaded by producing, because it does not depend on cooperating [causes].🔽And the non-producer, by the superimposition of contradictory properties of being capable and incapable, is indeed different.

analyzed: nanu bhavatu prasaṅga viparyyaya balāt eka kāryyam pratiśakta aśakta tva lakṣaṇa virudva dharmma adhyāsaḥ
translated: But let there be the superimposition of contradictory properties of being capable and incapable with respect to one effect by the power of reductio and contraposition.

original: tathāpi na tato medaḥ sidhyati /🔽tathāhi bījamaṅkurādikaṃ kurvvad yadi yenaiva svabhāvenāṅkuraṃ karoti tenaiva kṣityādikantadākṣityādīnāmapyaṅkurasvābhāvyāpattiḥ /
analyzed: tathā api na tatas medaḥ sidhyati  tathā hi bījam aṅkura ādikam kurvvat yadi yena eva svabhāvena aṅkuram karoti tena eva kṣiti ādikam tadā akṣiti ādīnām api aṅkura svābhāvya āpattiḥ
translated: Even so, difference does not result from that.🔽For thus, if the seed, producing the sprout and so on, produces the sprout with just that intrinsic nature by which it produces the sprout, then the sprout would have the intrinsic nature of the earth and so on.

original: nānāsvabhāvatvena tu kārakatve svabhāvānāmanyonyābhāvāvyabhicāritvādekatra bhāvābhāvau parasparavirudvau syātāmityekamapi bījaṃ bhidyeta /
analyzed: nānā svabhāva tvena tu kāraka tve svabhāvānām anyonya abhāva avyabhicāri tvāt ekatra bhāva abhāvau paraspara virudvau syātām iti ekam api bījam bhidyeta
translated: But if it produces by having various intrinsic natures, then the intrinsic natures would be invariably concomitant with mutual absence, and existence and non-existence would be mutually contradictory in one [thing], so even a single seed would be divided.

analyzed: evam taila kṣaya vartti dāha ādikam
translated: Similarly, a lamp also has many natures such as the exhaustion of oil, the burning of the wick, etc.

analyzed: tathā pūrvva rūpam api uttara rūpa rasa gandha ādikam anekaiḥ svabhāvaiḥ parikaritam karoti
translated: In the same way, a previous form also produces a subsequent form, taste, smell, etc. with many natures.

original: teṣāñca svabhāvānāmanyonyābhāvāvyabhicārādvirudvānāṃ yoge pradīpādikaṃ bhidyeta /🔽na ca bhidyate /
analyzed: teṣām ca svabhāvānām anyonya abhāva avyabhicārāt virudvānām yoge pradīpa ādikam bhidyeta  na ca bhidyate
translated: And because those natures are mutually exclusive and invariably concomitant, when opposites are combined, the lamp, etc. would be different.🔽But it is not different.

analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.
The superimposition of contradictory properties is what distinguishes [them].

original: tathā bījasyāṅkuraṃ prati kārakatvaṃ garddabhādikaṃ pratyakārakatvamiti kārakatvākārakatve api virudvau dharmau /
analyzed: tathā bījasya aṅkuram prati kāraka tvam garddabha ādikam prati akāraka tvam iti kāraka tva akāraka tve api virudvau dharmau
translated: Similarly, a seed has the property of being an agent with respect to a sprout, and the property of not being an agent with respect to a donkey, etc. Thus, being an agent and not being an agent are also contradictory properties.

analyzed: na ca tad yoge bīja bhedaḥ
translated: And even when combined with that, the seed is not different.

original: tadevamekatra bīje pradīpe rūpe ca vipakṣe paridṛśyamānaḥ śaktāśaktatvādirvirudvadharmmādhyāso na ghaṭāderbhedaka iti /
analyzed: tat evam ekatra bīje pradīpe rūpe ca vipakṣe paridṛśyamānaḥ śakta aśakta tva ādiḥ virudva dharmma adhyāsaḥ na ghaṭa ādeḥ bhedakaḥ iti
translated: Thus, the superimposition of contradictory properties such as being able and unable, which is seen in a single seed and in a lamp and form as the opposite, does not distinguish a pot, etc.

analyzed: atra brūmaḥ
translated: Here we say:

analyzed: bhavatu tāvat vīja ādīnām aneka kāryya kāri tvāt varmma bhūta aneka svabhāva bhedaḥ tathā api kaḥ prastāvaḥ virudva dharmma adhyāsasya
translated: Let there be, for the time being, the distinction of having many natures that are like parts, due to the production of many effects by seeds, etc. Nevertheless, what occasion is there for the superimposition of contradictory properties?

original: svabhāvānāṃ hyanyonyābhāvāvyabhicāre bhedaḥ prāptāvasaro na virodhaḥ /
analyzed: svabhāvānām hi anyonya abhāva avyabhicāre bhedaḥ prāpta avasaraḥ na virodhaḥ
translated: For, if the natures of things were invariably concomitant with mutual absence, difference would be impossible, and contradiction would be impossible.

original: virodhastu yadvidhāne yanniṣedho yanniṣedhe yadvidhānaṃ tayorekatradharmmiṇi parasparaparihārasthitatayā syāt /
analyzed: virodhaḥ tu yad vidhāne yad niṣedhaḥ yad niṣedhe yad vidhānam tayoḥ ekatra dharmmiṇi paraspara parihāra sthita tayā syāt
translated: But contradiction is when the affirmation of one thing is the negation of another, and the affirmation of another is the negation of the first, and these two are mutually exclusive with respect to a single thing.

original: tadatraikaḥ svbhāvaḥ svābhāvena virudvo yukto bhāvābhāvavat /
analyzed: tat atra ekaḥ svbhāvaḥ svābhāvena virudvaḥ yuktaḥ bhāva abhāva vat
translated: Here, one nature is properly contradictory to another nature, like existence and non-existence,

analyzed: na tu svabhāva antareṇa
translated: but not to a different nature.

analyzed: ghaṭa tva vastu tva vat
translated: Like pot-ness and substance-ness.

analyzed: evam aṅkura ādi kāri tvam tad akāri tvena virudvam na punar vastu antara kāri tvena
translated: In the same way, the production of a sprout is contradictory to non-production, but not to the production of another thing.

analyzed: pratyakṣa vyāpāraḥ ca atra yathā nānā dharmmaiḥ adhyāsitam bhāvam abhinnam vyavasthāpayati
translated: And here, just as perception establishes a thing as non-different, even though it is qualified by many properties,

analyzed: tathā tad kāryya kāriṇam kāryya antarākāriṇam ca
translated: in the same way, it establishes the producer of that effect as the producer of another effect.

original: tadyadi pratiyogitvābhāvādanyonyābhāvāvyabhicāri ṇāvapi svabhāvāvavirudvo tatkārakatvānyākārakatve vā viṣayabhedādavirudve /
analyzed: tat yadi pratiyogi tva abhāvāt anyonya abhāva avyabhicāri ṇau api svabhāvau avirudvau tad kāraka tva anya ākāraka tve vā viṣaya bhedāt avirudve
translated: If these two natures, even though invariably concomitant with mutual absence due to the absence of being a counter-correlate, are not contradictory, or if the production of that and the production of another are not contradictory due to the difference of objects,🔽then the production of a sprout would not be contradictory to the production of another thing.

analyzed: tat kim āyātam eka kāryyam prati śakta aśakta tvayoḥ paraspara pratiyoginīḥ virudvayoḥ dharmmayoḥ
translated: Then, what is the connection between the two mutually contradictory properties of being able and being unable with regard to a single effect?

analyzed: etayoḥ api punar avirodhe virodhaḥ nāma datta jala añjaliḥ
translated: If there is no contradiction even between these two, then contradiction is like one who has offered water libations.

analyzed: bhavatu tarhi eka kāryya apekṣayā eva sāmarthya asāmarthyayoḥ virodhaḥ
translated: Let it be that the contradiction between ability and inability is only in relation to a single effect.

original: kevalaṃ yathā tadeva kāryyaṃ prati kvaciddeśe śaktirdeśāntare cāśaktiriti deśabhedādavirudve śaktayaśaktī tathaikatraiva kāryye kālabhedādapyavirudve
analyzed: kevalam yathā tat eva kāryyam prati kvacid deśe śaktiḥ deśa antare ca aśaktiḥ iti deśa bhedāt avirudve śakti aśaktī tathā ekatra eva kāryye kāla bhedāt api avirudve
translated: Just as ability and inability are non-contradictory due to difference in place, where the same thing has ability with regard to a certain place and inability with regard to another place, in the same way, they are also non-contradictory due to difference in time with regard to a single effect.

original: yathāpūrvvaṃ nniḥkriyaḥ sphaṭikaḥ sa eva paścāt sakriya iti cet /
analyzed: yathāpūrvam n niḥkriyaḥ sphaṭikaḥ saḥ eva paścāt sa kriyaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the same crystal was inactive before but later becomes active,

original: ucyate / na hi vayaṃ paribhāṣāmātrādekatra kāryye deśabhedādavirudve śaktyaśaktī brūmaḥ /
analyzed: ucyate na hi vayam paribhāṣā mātrāt ekatra kāryye deśa bhedāt avirudve śakti aśaktī brūmaḥ
translated: it is said: We do not say that ability and inability are non-contradictory due to difference in place with regard to a single effect, merely on the basis of convention.

analyzed: kintu virodha abhāvāt
translated: But rather because there is no contradiction.

analyzed: tad deśa kāryya kāri tvam hi tad deśa kāryyākāri tvena virudvam
translated: For having the ability to produce an effect in a certain place is contradictory to not having the ability to produce an effect in that place.

analyzed: na punar deśāntare tad kāryyākāri tvena anya kāryya kāri tvena vā
translated: But not with regard to having the ability to produce that effect in another place, or with regard to having the ability to produce a different effect.

analyzed: yadi evam tad kāla kāryya kāri tvam tad kāla kāryyākāri tvena virudvam
translated: If it is so, then the state of producing an effect at that time is contradictory to the state of not producing that effect at that time.

analyzed: na punar kāla antare tad kāryya akāri tvena anya kāryya kāri tvena vā
translated: But not in producing another effect at another time or in producing a different effect.

analyzed: tat katham kāla bhede virodhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked how there can be contradiction even with a difference in time,

analyzed: ucyate
translated: it is said:

original: dvayorhi dharmmayorekatradharmmiṇyanavasthitiniyamaḥ parasparaparihārasthitilakṣaṇo virodhaḥ /🔽sa ca sākṣātparasparapratyanīkatayā bhāvābhāvavadvā bhavet /🔽ekasya vā niyamena pramāṇāntareṇa bādhanānnityatvasattvavadvā bhavediti na kaścidarthabhedaḥ /
analyzed: dvayoḥ hi dharmmayoḥ ekatra dharmmiṇi anavasthiti niyamaḥ paraspara parihāra sthiti lakṣaṇaḥ virodhaḥ  sa ca sākṣāt paraspara pratyanīka tayā bhāva abhāvavat vā bhavet  ekasya vā niyamena pramāṇa antareṇa bādhanāt nitya tva sattva vat vā bhavet iti na kaścid artha bhedaḥ
translated: For the contradiction of two properties in one substratum is the restriction of non-abiding, characterized by the state of mutual exclusion.🔽And that may be directly by mutual opposition, like existence and non-existence, or by the restriction of one by another means of valid knowledge, like eternality and existence. So there is no difference in meaning.

original: tadatraikadharmmiṇi tat kālakāryyakāritvādhāre kālāntare tatkāryyākāritvasyānyakāryyakāritvasya vā niyamena pramāṇāntareṇa bādhanādvirodhaḥ
analyzed: tat atra eka dharmmiṇi tat kāla kāryya kāri tva ādhāre kāla antare tad kāryya akāri tvasya anya kāryya kāri tvasya vā niyamena pramāṇa antareṇa bādhanāt virodhaḥ
translated: Here, in one substratum, the basis of the state of producing an effect at that time, there is contradiction by the restriction of the state of producing that effect at another time or the state of producing a different effect by another means of valid knowledge.

original: tathā hi yatraiva dharmmiṇi tatkālakāryyakāritvamupalabdhanna tatraiva kālāntare tat kāryyākāritvamanyakāryyakāritvaṃ vā brahmaṇāpyupasaṃharttuṃ
analyzed: tathā hi yatra eva dharmmiṇi tad kāla kāryya kāri tvam upalabdham na tatra eva kāla antare tat kāryyākāri tvam anya kāryya kāri tvam vā brahmaṇā api upasaṃharttum
translated: For, in that very substratum where the production of an effect at that time is observed, there alone at a later time the production of that effect or the production of another effect cannot be set aside even by Brahman,

analyzed: yena anayoḥ avirodhaḥ syāt
translated: by which there would be no contradiction between these two.

analyzed: kṣaṇa antare kathita prasaṅga viparyyaya hetubhyām avaśyambhāvena dharmmi bheda prasādhanāt
translated: Because the difference of substrata is established by the necessary consequence and the contrary reason stated in the next moment.

analyzed: na ca pratyabhijñānāt eka tva sidviḥ
translated: And the oneness is not established by recognition.

analyzed: tat pauruṣasya nirmmūlita tvāt
translated: Because that is baseless.

original: ata eva vajro 'pi pakṣakūkṣau nikṣiptaḥ kathamasau sphaṭiko varākaḥ kālabhedenābhedāsādhanāya dṛṣṭāntībhavitumarhati /
analyzed: atas eva vajraḥ pi pakṣa kūkṣau nikṣiptaḥ katham asau sphaṭikaḥ varākaḥ kāla bhedena abheda asādhanāya dṛṣṭāntībhavitum arhati
translated: For this very reason, even the thunderbolt, placed in the womb of the opponent, how can that poor crystal be fit to be an example for proving non-difference by difference in time?

original: na caivaṃ samānakālakāryyāṇāṃ deśabhede 'pi dharmmibhedo yukto bhedasādhakapramāṇābhāvādindriyapratyakṣeṇa nirastavibhramāśaṅkenābhedaprasādhanācca
analyzed: na ca evam samāna kāla kāryyāṇām deśa bhede pi dharmmi bhedaḥ yuktaḥ bheda sādhaka pramāṇa abhāvāt indriya pratyakṣeṇa nirasta vibhrama āśaṅkena abheda prasādhanāt ca
translated: And thus, even in the case of effects occurring at the same time, the difference of substrata is not proper even in the case of spatial difference, due to the absence of a means of establishing difference, and because non-difference is established by sense perception, free from doubt of error.

original: iti na kālabhede 'pi śaktyaśaktyorvirodhaḥ svasamayamātrādapahastayituṃ śakyaḥ /
analyzed: iti na kāla bhede pi śakti aśaktyoḥ virodhaḥ sva samaya mātrāt apahastayitum śakyaḥ
translated: Thus, even in the case of difference in time, the contradiction between ability and inability cannot be set aside merely by one's own opinion.

analyzed: samaya pramāṇayoḥ apravṛtteḥ iti
translated: Because the means of knowledge and the conventions are not operative.

analyzed: tasmāt sarvvatra virudva dharmma adhyāsa sidviḥ eva bheda sidviḥ
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the difference is only the establishment of the superimposition of contradictory properties everywhere.

analyzed: vipratipannam prati tu virudva dharmma adhyāsāt bheda vyavahāraḥ sādhyate
translated: But in the case of a disputed matter, the usage of difference is established by the superimposition of contradictory properties.

analyzed: nanu tathā api sattvam idam anaikāntikam evā asādhāraṇa tvāt sandigdha vyatireka tvāt vā
translated: But even so, this existence is indeed inconclusive, because of the lack of a common property or because of the doubtful exclusion.

analyzed: yathā hi idam kramākrama nivṛttaḥ akṣaṇikāt nivṛttam
translated: For just as this [existence] is excluded from the non-momentary by the exclusion of sequence and simultaneity,

analyzed: tathā sāpekṣa tva anāpekṣa tvayoḥ ekatva anekatvayoḥ api vyāpakayoḥ nivṛttau kṣaṇikāt api
translated: in the same way, when the two all-pervading properties of dependence and independence, and unity and plurality, are excluded, [existence] is also excluded from the momentary.

original: tathāhyupasapaṇapratyayena devadattakarapallavādinā sahacaro vījakṣaṇaḥ pūrvvasmādeva puñjāt samarthojāto 'napekṣa ādyātiśayasya janaka iṣyate
analyzed: tathā hi upasapaṇa pratyayena devadatta kara pallava ādinā sahacaraḥ vīja kṣaṇaḥ pūrvvasmāt eva puñjāt samarthaḥ jātaḥ na apekṣaḥ ādya atiśayasya janakaḥ iṣyate
translated: For indeed, Devadatta's hand, etc., which are associated with the condition of proximity, are considered to be born from the same heap as the seed-moment, independent, and capable of producing the initial excess.

original: tatra ca samānakuśūlajanmasu bahuṣu vijasantāneṣu kasmāt kiñcideva vījaṃ paramparayāṅkurotpādānuguṇamupajanayati bījakṣaṇānnānye vījakṣaṇā
analyzed: tatra ca samāna kuśūla janmasu bahuṣu vija santāneṣu kasmāt kiñcid eva vījam paramparayā aṅkura utpāda anuguṇam upajanayati bīja kṣaṇāt na anye vīja kṣaṇāḥ
translated: And among the many seed-series born in the same granary, why does only a certain seed produce, through a series, what is conducive to the production of the sprout, and not the other seed-moments?

original: nahyupasarpaṇapratyayāt prāgeva teṣāṃ samānāsamānasantānavarttināṃ vījakṣaṇānāṃ kaścit paramparātiśayaḥ /🔽athopasarpaṇāt prāṅna tat santāna varttino 'pi janayanti paramparayāpyaṅkurotpādānuguṇaṃ vījakṣaṇaṃ vījamātrajananātteṣāṃ /
analyzed: nahi upasarpaṇa pratyayāt prāk eva teṣām samāna asamāna santāna varttinām vīja kṣaṇānām kaścid paramparā atiśayaḥ  atha upasarpaṇāt prāk na tat janayanti paramparayā api aṅkura utpāda anuguṇam vīja kṣaṇam vīja mātra jananāt teṣām
translated: For, prior to the cognition of approach, there is no special difference in the seed-moments belonging to the same or different continua.🔽If, prior to approach, they do not generate even those belonging to the same continuum, then the seed-moments conducive to the production of the sprout are just seeds, because they generate only seeds.

analyzed: kasyacid eva vīja kṣaṇasya upasarpaṇa pratyaya sahabhuvaḥ ādya atiśaya utpādaḥ
translated: For some seed-moment, the initial excess is produced simultaneously with the condition of approach.

original: hanta tarhi yadabhāve satyutpannopi na janayedeva /
analyzed: hanta tarhi yad abhāve sati utpannaḥ api na janayet eva
translated: Well then, if it is produced in the absence of that, it would not generate at all.

original: tathā kevalānāṃ vyabhicārasambhavādādyātiśayotpādamaṅkuraṃ vā prati kṣityādīnāṃ parasparāpekṣāṇāmevotpādakatvamakāmakenāpi svīkarttavyaṃ /
analyzed: tathā kevalānām vyabhicāra sambhavāt ādya atiśaya utpādam aṅkuram vā prati kṣiti ādīnām paraspara apekṣāṇām eva utpādaka tvam akāmakena api svīkarttavyam
